long_desc.thetext:
Currently if I use an API release as x-internal I get the following error message:
Discouraged access: The method ..... from the type .... is not accessible due to restriction on required project ....
This is always confusing to the participants of my plug-in and RCP training sessions.
Can we change it to something like:
Discouraged access: The method ..... from the type .... is not released as official API in project ....

The message is from JDT, not PDE. PDE adds the Plug-in dependencies container to your project's build path. We add the various bundles to that container. We add access restrictions to the jar content based on what the manifest specifies.
Accessible: Anything marked as public Discouraged: Anything marked as public x-internal Forbidden: Everything else
I don't see how we could provide more information to the user so I'm closing as WONTFIX. Obviously reopen if you have a code change in mind.

Thanks Curtis, I think the existing functionality is perfect. Just the text of the error message could be improved.
The current message says "is not accessible" and that is confusing for the user, as they can access the API.
Therefore I suggest to change the text of the warning message to something like:
Discouraged access: The method ..... from the type .... is not released as official API in project ....
or
Discouraged access: The method ..... from the type .... is not released as official API due to restriction on required project ....
I change the component to JDT, if that is there the error message is coming from.

I'll let JDT comment, but note that PDE does not provide any information on why the access restrictions are on the container. Unless JDT has a way to add this information, they cannot change the message to be specific about API.

(In reply to Curtis Windatt from comment #3) > I'll let JDT comment, but note that PDE does not provide any information on > why the access restrictions are on the container. Unless JDT has a way to > add this information, they cannot change the message to be specific about > API.
Not sure what you mean. We know it is "Discouraged", therefore it is accessible but not released. In which scenario would this be wrong?

(In reply to Lars Vogel from comment #4) > Not sure what you mean. We know it is "Discouraged", therefore it is > accessible but not released. In which scenario would this be wrong?
The wording you have suggested is speaking about API in the OSGi sense. Access restrictions could be added for any reason the library chooses (JRE restrict certain extension jars for example). I don't think JDT will want to change the wording.

(In reply to Curtis Windatt from comment #5) > The wording you have suggested is speaking about API in the OSGi sense. > Access restrictions could be added for any reason the library chooses (JRE > restrict certain extension jars for example). I don't think JDT will want > to change the wording.
Thanks, makes sense. What about:
---------- Discouraged access: The method ..... from the type .... has access restrictions on required project .... ----------
or something similar.
Adding the M7 tag so JDT can evaluate this.

We definitely have to change the message. Especially for Luna where Equinox dropped the strict mode. This means from on Equinox and OSGi standpoint x-internal has no meaning at all anymore. It's purely a hint to developers that such code should not be used. I suggest we rename the warning to:
Discouraged access: The type 'X' should not be accessed due to restriction on required project 'x'. It is not considered API.
Markus, is this OK for you or do you have a better wording.

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #8) Discussed with Dani and came up with a shorter message that doesn't repeat "access":
"Discouraged access: The type 'X' is not API (restriction on required project 'x')"

Created attachment 241842 Proposed fix
The patch just fixes the messages, but not the jdt.core tests.
Also replaces the clumsy "The method/field {1} from the type {2} ..." with "The method/field ''{2}.{1}'' ..."
Manoj, please take it forward. Thanks a lot Markus for the patch.

Created attachment 242141 Proposed Patch
The fix with the tests cases modified. Jay: Apart from the message changes in the patch supplied by Markus, only JDT core test cases were changed to reflect the modified error message. If you can do a quick glance through, then I can commit the patch and resolve the bug.

Changes to tests look good to me. Although I think the new message is not very clear to me. If we wanted to convey "The type X is not API and restrictions on classpath entry Y don't make non API to be accessible"
Then this message (at least to me) doesn't seem to clearly do that:
The type X is not API (restriction on classpath entry Y)
But I don't have any alternate suggestions that are short enough. So, if others are fine with it, Manoj, please can go ahead and release it.
Thanks Jay for the review. Fix released via commit: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=e2d31ef7ac94c5bb6285f9813df43a1164c5ca8d
Thanks everyone. This was leading to some confusion with new Eclipse developers (at least in my training sessions) and it is very nice that the message is now much more informative to the user.

Lars has already acknowledged that he likes the new message better. Marking as verified.
Verified for 4.4 M7 with build I20140428-2000

I found one potential problem, its looks like the API message is a bit to aggressive:
If I use an internal class "Lars" I now get in the marker three message, IRC this used to be only one message.
Code:
public static void main(String[] args) { // TODO Auto-generated method stub Lars lars = new Lars(); }
Results in these message:
Multiple markers at this line - Discouraged access: The type 'Lars' is not API (restriction on required project 'test_internal') - Discouraged access: The constructor 'Lars()' is not API (restriction on required project 'test_internal') - Discouraged access: The type 'Lars' is not API (restriction on required project 'test_internal')
If this used to be also three messages in the past, please set this back to FIXED/VERIFIED.

(In reply to Lars Vogel from comment #17) > If this used to be also three messages in the past, please set this back to > FIXED/VERIFIED. Lars: This used to be three messages in the past as well. Moving back to Fixed.

(In reply to Manoj Palat from comment #18) > (In reply to Lars Vogel from comment #17) > > If this used to be also three messages in the past, please set this back to > > FIXED/VERIFIED. > Lars: This used to be three messages in the past as well. Moving back to > Fixed.
Thanks for the clarification and this change. Very helpful for my RCP / plug-in training sessions.
